mchorse.mappet.api.ui.components

Class UITrackpadComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • mchorse.mappet.api.ui.components.UIComponent
      • mchorse.mappet.api.ui.components.UITrackpadComponent

  • public class UITrackpadComponent
extends UIComponent
    Trackpad UI component.

    This component allows users to input numerical values (integer and double), with optionally a limit range between min and max. Users can also use arrow buttons on the side to increment and decrement the value, and type in value manually.

    The value that gets written to UI context's data (if ID is present) is the number displayed in the field, if integer option is enabled, then an integer will be written, or double if it's disabled.

    This component can be created using IMappetUIBuilder.trackpad() method.

    
    function main(c)
    {
        var ui = mappet.createUI(c, "handler").background();
        var trackpad = ui.trackpad(5).id("number").limit(0, 25, true);

        trackpad.rxy(0.5, 0.5).wh(160, 20).anchor(0.5);
        c.getSubject().openUI(ui);
    }

    function handler(c)
    {
        var uiContext = c.getSubject().getUIContext();
        var data = uiContext.getData();

        if (uiContext.getLast() === "number")
        {
            // If integer wasn't enabled, you would use:
            // data.getDouble("number")
            if (data.getInt("number") === 19)
            {
                c.getSubject().send("21");
            }
        }
    }

      Toggle integer option, when passed true then this trackpad component will accept only whole numbers, and when passed false, then both whole and floating point numbers can be accepted by this trackpad.

        public UITrackpadComponent integer(boolean integer)
        Toggle integer option, when passed true then this trackpad component will accept only whole numbers, and when passed false, then both whole and floating point numbers can be accepted by this trackpad.

        Convenience method that allows to set minimum, maximum, and integer options that this trackpad field can accept.

      • amplitudes

        public UITrackpadComponent amplitudes(double normal)
        Changes the amplitudes of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much value changes when moving the cursor horizontally. Weak (Alt amplitude gets set 5 times weaker than input value, and strong (Shift) amplitude gets set 5 times stronger than input value.

      • amplitudes

        public UITrackpadComponent amplitudes(double normal,
                                      double weak,
                                      double strong)
        Changes the amplitudes of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much value changes when moving the cursor horizontally.
        Parameters:
        normal - Value change per pixel when no modifiers is held.
        weak - Value change per pixel when alt is held.
        strong - Value change per pixel when shift is held.

      • increment

        public UITrackpadComponent increment(double increment)
        Changes the incremental value of this trackpad fields, i.e. how much being added or subtracted when user presses < and > buttons on the sides of the trackpad value.
        Parameters:
        increment - Value change per click on increment buttons.
